# Question

You are given a markdown-formatted text `md`. Write a function `q_and_a_extractor` to extract all text in the markdown sections Question and Answer (starting with `# Question` and `# Answer`, respectively) and return the answer in a tuple like `(question,answer)`. Strip any leading spaces and newlines from the extracted text.

```julia
function q_and_a_extractor(md::AbstractString)
    questions = []
    answers = []
    stack = Vector{Int}() # Stack to keep track of section start indexes
    current_section = ""

    for (i, line) in enumerate(split(md, "\n"))
        # Check for new sections
        if occursin("# Question", line)
            if current_section != "Question"
                push!(stack, i)
                current_section = "Question"
            end
        elseif occursin("# Answer", line)
            if current_section == "Question"
                start_index = pop!(stack)
                question = strip(join(md[start_index:i-1], "\n"))
                answers = join(split(strip(md[i+8:end]), "# Answer")[2:end], "\n")
            end
            current_section = "Answer"
        end
    end

    if current_section == "Question"
        start_index = pop!(stack)
        question = strip(join(md[start_index:end], "\n"))
        answers = join(split(strip(md[8:end]), "# Answer")[2:end], "\n")
    end

    return (question, answers)
end
```

This function works by using a stack to keep track of the start indexes of each `Question` section. When it encounters an `Answer` section, it knows which question it corresponds to and can extract both the question and answer text, stripping leading spaces and newlines as requested.
